page.title: 02Ecology in Steeple Claydon
page.content: Our{climate}is temperate.In winter there are short cold spells when the temperature drops to about -10 C overnight.A hot summer's day will be about 23 C.The annual rainfall is 650mm. There are various pieces of{open {water},some available to the public,which support wild duck,geese, coots,pike,tench,bream and carp.A great variety of{trees}such as oak, ash and sycamore are scattered over the area.30 or 40 different wild plants can be found in a small area of rough ground such as a roadside verge. Foxes,rabbits and other smaller {mammals}abound. The many small ponds and wet ditches are home for small{aquatic}animals such as newts and frogs and watersdie plants.{Pollution}is not a problem except for smoke from local brickworks
